intro: Erica sertiflora, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained, acidic soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Erica sertiflora is well adapted to coastal and mountainous regions, often forming shrubs up to 1 meter in height. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
